captions.text: [The messages] this season complete the previous seasons, they do not contradict them
Guide us to the Straight Path
Comfort us [with the call to prayer] Bilal????
To deepen our connection to prayer, it's important to understand its effects on every aspect of our daily lives
Does our brain [structure] change when we pray? Or does it stay the same?
Do our bodies change, or not?
We conducted an experiment, which is as follows:
How does the scan work? They put a radioactive substance in the body which courses with our blood circulation, including the brain
I took a brain scan: I went under a machine for almost an hour which completely scans the brains and creates an image like an X- ray
Then I prayed a prayer without khushu [humility] by praying quickly and letting my mind wander (not concentrating)
Unfortunately many of us, including me, pray in this manner on a daily basis
This is what happens when we approach prayer as a routine and are in a rush. It's a prayer without khushu
I'm going to undergo another scan to see if there was any difference
Praying without khushu did not impact my brain in any way
The top is a picture before praying and the bottom is after praying without khushu.
Quick prayers without khushu had no impact whatsoever
That's why, a companion of the Prophet (PBUH) was told by the Prophet (PBUH) after praying in the masjid,
"Pray, because you have not prayed"... despite the companion having [physically] prayed
"Pray, because you have not prayed; What I did here [praying in a rushed manner] was as if I hadn't prayed
It has no meaning or effect
I then prayed with khushu, or as much as khushu as I could.
I took yet another brain scan to see what kind of effect [the prayer] had
Did my brain [structure] change because of my prayer or not?
I was surprised, and so was the doctor, from the results
First, there's a noticeable difference in the brain [structure].

[Right: before the prayer with khushu, left: after prayer]
There's a radical difference in multiple areas of the brain
[The doctor explained] there was a reduction in activity in areas of the brain where thinking occurs
When there is less thought process occuring, it means you are submitting to something
"Sovereign of the Day of Recompense" [1:4]
[Prayer is about] submission to the Sovereign of this day, Allah (SWT)
"It is You we worship and You we ask for help." [1:5]
This is about submission and surrendering during prayer and asking God to guide us to the straight path
When we pray we are asking God to guide our thoughts
When this vital part [frontal lobe] in our lives - the thought process- is reactivated
[We are asking God to guide our thoughts] to the straight path when we think about our problems and concerns [after prayer]
The activity increased in the part of the brain that is concerned with forgiveness and compassion
The Most Compassionate, the most Merciful is repeated in every prayer, in every rakaa to embody the idea of mercy
If we pray with khushu, the idea of rahma [mercy, compassion] will be incarnated in our brains
This is an indicator that people without mercy who pray five times a day should ask themselves
"What has [my prayer] done to activate this area of my brain?". It's obvious that it hasn't activated [this area]
Your sense of self has decreased and therefore there is more of a connection

The word for 'prayer' in Arabic - 'salah'- means link. 
Our prayers should increase our connection to God
If our link to God increases, activity in the brain related to independence and sense of self should, and did, decrease
By God, all things are linked to one another. This is what prayer [is all about]
Also in the West, there has been increased appreciation of the benefits of meditation in students' performance
Students in one school had a lot of problems, including fights and bullying, so the school introduced the idea of meditation
They set aside a specific time every day during school hours for students to close their eyes and meditate
After introducing this 'Quiet Time', there was noticeably less violence and fighting in school
One of the aims of prayer is to calm us.
I recommend that schools that do not have prayer times at school reconsider this and reintroduce prayer
at least praying Dhur [noon prayer] as a congregation
Schools that do have prayer times should rejuvenate the approach and education about prayer
This includes learning about khushu, quietness and peace; this needs to be taught in school
Students need to see that prayer isn't just a routine that has no impact on their lives; one can't pray then go back to fighting
Some beautiful analogies include relating almsgiving [sadaqa] to prayer
Sadaqa is giving of money while prayer is giving of time
A beautiful comparison relates how zakat should amount to 2.5% of your money
while prayer should amount to at least 2.5% of your time
In 24 hours [1 day], they found that prayer should take at least 36 minutes of your day
By dividing this time over the 17 rakat in the prayers, each rakaa should take you [at least] 2 minutes
Dhur prayer, for example, should take you at least 8 minutes to complete
This is the minimum amount of time to really take advantage of this prayer in its steps and in khushu
Today is Sunday and people are congregating in church
This church is strange, though, in that it is not like other churches
It's a church for atheists
It's called 'Godless Congregation'
Let's check it out
One of the natural elements of all humanity is the need to feel linked to something
If someone doesn't find this connection to God through those that represent God's teachings,
s/he will look for this connection elsewhere and that's the purpose [this church] serves
If a masjid doesn't fulfill people's needs or if the Friday khutbah doesn't speak to people's needs
if the words don't enter our hearts, minds and thoughts, people will be repelled from the masjid
Churches have alienated people; churches bear the responsibility of the number of atheists in Europe
because they made God an aversion to His creation over the years of misusing religion
They are just now realizing this and trying to fix their mistakes
The [churches] got a huge negative reaction from the people
I pray to God that this doesn't happen to us in our Muslim world
This is starting to emerge, unfortunately, and there are people who are starting to make people hate the Deen [religion]
They may have good intentions but their approach [is harmful]
Pious people have a duty to their society
A scholar once said, which really applies in this situation behind me, world
"Half of the sins related to the spread of kufr [disbelief] in the world should be attributed to pious/religious people"
Religious people are responsible for half of the spread of kufr"
Why? Relgious people have made people hate God by approaching [them, religion] in the wrong way"
Is the effect of prayer only limited to the brain or are there are physical impacts?
We're at a center to measure our body's energy levels,
As with the brain scan, we're going to look at the before and after prayer to see the impacts of prayer on energy levels
We'll look at the results after I pray
We're looking at the energy levels before and after prayer in pixels
Before praying my energy was 19,400 pixels and after praying my energy was 22,000
That's approximately a 12% increase in overall energy

[Top is before, bottom is after]
These show the chakras, or the 7 energy focal points
Before praying, two were out of line: the top-most one and [the second to last]
My energy became more balanced as well as bigger in size
The relationship between the increased godlessness in society and the increase in suicide rates is clear
Here's an example comparing South Korea and Armenia:
The average income in Armenia is $6,000 USD/year while in South Korea the average income is $33,000 USD/year
That's approximately 5 times the average income in Armenia
Unemployment in Armenia is two times the unemployment rate in South Korea
Based on these variables, and the huge difference in the populations' financial quality of life,
Which society do you expect to have a greater suicide rate?
The richer or poorer people?
The suicide rate in South Korea is 31 of every 100,000 people
whereas in Armenia the suicide rate is 2 of every 100,000 people
So the suicide rate in South Korea is 16 times greater than in Armenia
Why? There is a huge difference in the number of spiritual people
More than 50% of the population in South Korea is atheist and doesn't believe in God or the Day of Judgement
whereas in Armenia, more than 90% of the population follows a faith and believe in God and the Day of Judgement
Consequently people in each society reflect on their given situations and react differently
We aren't able to make any comparisons in the Muslim and Arab world because there are not enough accurate statistics
There's no doubt, however, that in our part of the world the suicide rate is generally lower
Cases of suicide may exist but it couldn't be considered a phenomenon
One of the main reasons for this is faith in Islam, despite difficult circumstances in this life and injustice,
and the belief in a Day of Judgement, stops people from committing suicide
We've covered many of the positive aspects of Japanese culture and society in Tokyo in previous seasons
In the midst of all this development and this economic, social and even, to a large extent, ethical prosperity,
this does not compensate for gaps in the inner soul and spirit
That's why [in the Quran it says both] "those who have believed and done righteous deeds" [103:3]
The suicide rate here confirms this
Let's ask the people around us whether they know anyone, friend or family member, who has committed suicide
We're going to ask 10 people and see how many of them have lost loved ones to suicide
50% of the people we asked know a friend or family member who has committed suicide
Japan is one of the top 10 countries in terms of highest suicide rate
The people we talked to cited a variety of reasons of why loved ones committed suicide
A colleague was facing a lot of work-related stress and didn't know how to deal with it so she committed suicide
Two had illnesses
All of these experiences indicate a lack of ability in dealing with pains, whether spiritual or physical
One of the biggest benefits of faith is that one seeks refuge in something bigger than him/herself
If someone [with faith] is exposed to a lot of pain, they will seek refuge in God
[Prayer] "There is no refuge from You [God], except seeking refuge in You"
The train system in Japan is very modern and an exemplar in engineering feats
The primary reason for installing the [barriers], other than preventing accidents,
is to protect people and prevent them from committing suicide
This is the manager of this train station; he has statistics on the number of people committing suicide in train stations
On this route alone [the green line], there are 10-20 suicides per year. There are many other lines as well
Japanese are known for being well-read; what's weird is that they have an entire section about suicide
[Book title] "Don't commit suicide because of money";
a lot of people commit suicide because they have debts or can't deal with financial stress
This book is about saving the 30,000 people who want to commit suicide;
according to statistics that's the average number of people who commit suicide each year
What's strange is among these books is one that teaches you how to commit suicide
This book is not allowed for those under 18; but if you're over 18, you can learn how to commit suicide
We're in Hinohara, a forest in Tokyo; thousands of Japanese people have committed suicide in this forest
So many people have committed suicide here that it's known as "Suicide Forest"
Hundreds of people commit suicide here; these are just some cases:
These pictures are disturbing
[Quranic verse] "And We will surely test you with something of fear and hunger and a loss of wealth and lives and fruits,"
(all the pains that a human may face)
[Continuation of verse] "but give good tidings to the patient," [2:155]
The Quran has shown us how to deal with these tests
"Who, when disaster strikes them, say, "Indeed we belong to Allah , and indeed to Him we will return."" [2:156]
In any kind of disaster they will say "Indeed we belong to Allah , and indeed to Him we will return."
"Those are the ones upon whom are blessings from their Lord and mercy."
Those who seek refuge in God will find this mercy and peace
[Continuation of verse] "And it is those who are the [rightly] guided." [2:157]
By God, they've even put notices for people who want to commit suicide at the entrance of the forest
[Sign] "Life was given to you by your parents and it is a very valuable thing, so please think calmly about your parents,
your siblings and your children. Please don't think you're alone, call us" They've provided people with a suicide hotline
Look at how spirituality is absence from this sign;
it only asks people to think about their family- who might be the reason for their suicide;
sometimes social stress may cause suicide
The Japanese still have very strong moral and ethical values; this [phenomenon of suicide] doesn't negate that
There are strong ethical values and equality between people. They have done righteous deeds, but they have not believed
Without both faith and righteous deeds, [people] will not have inner peace or comfort in their lives

comments.text:
شككرا وفقك الله  
نصائح مفيدة

comments.text:
الله يوفقك وانا مارحاقول الا الشيء الصح انه الصلاة عماد الدين و انه عشان 
الصلاة تكون في اقصى درجات القبول لازم الانسان يكون خاشع في الصلاة و ممكن 
يتأثر كثير و الاستاذ احمد الشقيري ما قال غير كذة وبس ما حدا يألف من عنده.﻿

comments.text:
ي ليت لو هالحلقه بالذات مترجمه للانجليزي 
اتوقع فيه كثثير ناس راح يدخلوا الاسلام بسببها ، وفيه ناس يدخلوا للاسلام 
ويصلوا ومو مقتنعين ليش هما بيصلوا او ايش الغرض منها فبيتهانوا فيهاا فهذي 
الحلقه رااح تفههمهم اهميتهاا وفايدتهاا 
اتمنى لو تترجم (حلقات #خواطر ) وهذي الحلقه بالذذذذذات ❤ ﻿
